form.preferredDefinition: The Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI) assesses perceived disability due to dizziness (i.e., vertigo). This 25-item self-administered questionnaire contains three subscales which cover the areas of function, emotion, and physical aspects. Points from each subscale can be combined to assign a total score, or they can be combined by subscale.

headerInstruction.text: Instructions: The purpose of this scale is to identify difficulties that you may be experiencing because of dizziness or unsteadiness. Please answer "yes," "no," or "sometimes" to each question. Answer each question as it applies to your dizz..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Does looking up increase your problem? (looking_up_increases_problem)
Because of your problem, do you feel frustrated? (feel_frustrated)
Because of your problem, do you restrict your travel for business or recreation? (restrict_travel)
Does walking down the aisle of a supermarket increase your problem? (walking_down_aisle_increase_problem)
Because of your problem, do you have difficulty getting into or out of bed? (difficulty_getting_out_of_bed)
Does your problem significantly restrict your participation in social activities such as going out to dinner, the movies, dancing or to parties? (problem_restricts_social_participation)
Because of your problem, do you have difficulty reading? (difficulty_reading)
Does performing more ambitious activities such as sports or dancing or household chores such as sweeping or putting dishes away increase your problem? (sports_dancing_chores_increases_problems)
Because of your problem, are your afraid to leave your home without having someone accompany you? (afraid_to_leave_home_unaccompanied)
Because of your problem, are you embarrassed in front of others? (embarrassed_in_front_of_others)
Do quick movements of your head increase your problem? (quick_head_movements_increase_problem)
Because of your problem, do you avoid heights? (avoid_heights)
Does turning over in bed increase your problem? (turning_in_bed_increases_problems)
Because of your problem, is it difficult for you to do strenuous housework or yard work? (difficulty_with_house_yard_work)
Because of your problem, are you afraid people may think you are intoxicated? (people_think_intoxicated)
Because of your problem, is it difficult for you to walk by yourself? (difficult_walk_alone)
Does walking down a sidewalk increase your problem? (sidewalk_increase_problem)
Because of your problem, is it difficult for you to concentrate? (pxt201101_difficult_to_concentrate)
Because of your problem, is it difficult for you to walk around the house in the dark? (difficult_to_walk_in_dark)
Because of your problem, are you afraid to stay at home alone? (afraid_to_stay_home_alone)
Because of your problem, do you feel handicapped? (feel_handicapped)
Has your problem placed stress on your relationship with members of your family or friends? (relationship_stress)
Because of your problem, are you depressed? (problem_causes_depression)
Does your problem interfere with your job or household responsibilities? (problem_interfere_with_job)
Does bending over increase your problem? (bending_over_increases_problem)

SCORING: Physical Subscale: questions 1, 4, 8, 11, 13, 17, 25 Emotional Subscale: questions 2, 9, 10, 15, 18, 20, 21, 22, 23 Functional Subscale: questions 3, 5, 6, 7, 12, 14, 16, 19, 24 A "Yes" response receives 4 points A "Sometimes" response receives 2 points. A "No" response receives 0 points. The points can be combined to assign a total score, or they can be combined by subscale. The higher the points a patient scores, either total or for a particular subscale, the greater their perceived disability due to dizziness. Total Score: 10070 = severe perception of having a handicap 6940 = moderate perception of handicap 390 = low perception of handicap (scoring_201101)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI) assesses perceived disability due to dizziness (i.e., vertigo). This 25-item self-administered questionnaire contains three subscales which cover the areas of function, emotion, and physical aspects. Points from each subscale can be combined to assign a total score, or they can be combined by subscale.

form.longName: PhenX PX200401 - Family History Of Speech And Language Impairment
form.preferredDefinition: The Family History Questionnaire is a 9-item proxy-administered questionnaire completed by a parent for their young child. It asks about the child's personal and family history of speech and language impairment.

module.longName: Family History of Speech and Language Impairment
module.preferredDefinition: Family History of Speech and Language Impairment

question.questionText: By age 2, was your child talking in short phrases or sentences? (talking_short_sentences)
When your child was two years old, were you concerned that he/she was having difficulty learning to talk? (difficulty_learning_to_talk)
At this time, do people frequently have trouble understanding your child? (trouble_understanding_child)
Has anyone in your child's family had speech or language therapy? (family_history_speech_language_therapy)
Has anyone in your child's family had speech or language therapy? If Yes, Relationship to child? (family_history_speechlanguagetherapy_relationship)
Has anyone in your child's family had speech or language therapy? If Yes, What for? (family_history_speechlanguagetherapy_purpose)
Family: Parents and biologically related siblings (family_siblings)
Has anyone in your child's family had difficulty learning to read or had problems with school work? (e.g. repeated a grade) (difficulty_learning_to_read)
Has anyone in your child's family had difficulty learning to read or had problems with school work? (e.g. repeated a grade) If Yes, what are the details? (difficulty_learning_to_read_details)
Has anyone in your child's family been diagnosed as mentally retarded? (family_history_retardation)
Does anyone in your child's family have a hearing difficulty? (family_history_hearing_difficulty)
Has anyone in your child's family been slow in learning to talk? (family_history_slow_to_talk)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Stuttering (family_history_stuttering)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Is less talkative (family_history_less_talkative)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Has a hard time carrying on a conversation (family_history_trouble_carryon_conversation)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Doesn't like to read (family_history_doesnot_like_read)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Doesn't read well (family_history_doesnot_read_well)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Has difficulty thinking of words (s)he wants to say when talking (family_history_thinking_of_words)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Has a poorer vocabulary than other family members (family_history_poorer_vocabulary)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Is a poor speller (family_history_poor_speller)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Has awkward sentence structures when writing or talking (family_history_awkward_sentence_structure)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Mispronounces long words (family_history_mispronounce_long_words)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Is hard to follow when (s)he tells you something, such as a personal experience (family_history_hard_to_follow)
Has anyone in your child's family had any other type of communication disorder such as: Has difficulty explaining things (family_history_difficulty_explaining_things)

protocol.longName: Family History of Speech and Language Impairment
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Family History Questionnaire is a 9-item proxy-administered questionnaire completed by a parent for their young child. It asks about the child's personal and family history of speech and language impairment.

form.preferredDefinition: The Voice Handicap Index (VHI) is a 30-item self-administered questionnaire that asks individuals to describe their voice and the effects of their voice on their life. Three subscales cover the areas of functional, emotional, and physical aspects of voice disorders. Points from the questions can be combined to assign a total score, or they can be combined by subscale.

question.questionText: Instructions: These are statements that many people have used to describe their voices and the effects of their voices on their lives. Check the response that indicates how frequently you have the same experience. (nstructions_these_are_stat)
My voice makes it difficult for people to hear me. (difficult_for_people_hear_me)
I run out of air when I talk. (run_out_of_air)
People have difficulty understanding me in a noisy room. (difficulty_understanding_me_noisy_room)
The sound of my voice varies throughout the day. (sound_of_voice_varies)
My family has difficulty hearing me when I call them throughout the house. (family_difficulty_hearing_me)
I use the phone less often than I would like. (use_phone_less_often)
I'm tense when talking with others because of my voice. (tense_when_talking)
I tend to avoid groups of people because of my voice. (avoid_groups_due_to_voice)
People seem irritated with my voice. (people_irritated_with_my_voice)
People ask, "What's wrong with your voice?" (people_ask_about_voice)
I speak with friends, neighbors, or relatives less often because of my voice. (speak_less_often_to_friends)
People ask me to repeat myself when speaking facetoface. (people_ask_me_to_repeat)
My voice sounds creaky and dry. (voice_creaky_dry)
I feel as though I have to strain to produce voice. (strain_to_produce_voice)
I find other people don't understand my voice problem. (people_donot_understand_problem)
My voice difficulties restrict my personal and social life. (voice_restricts_personal_social_life)
The clarity of my voice is unpredictable. (voice_clarity_unpredictable)
I try to change my voice to sound different. (change_voice_to_sound_different)
I feel left out of conversations because of my voice. (feel_left_out_of_conversations)
I use a great deal of effort to speak. (great_deal_of_effort_speak)
My voice is worse in the evening. (voice_worse_evening)
My voice problem causes me to lose income. (voice_causes_lost_income)
My voice problem upsets me. (voice_upsets_me)
I am less outgoing because of my voice problem. (less_outgoing_dueto_voice)
My voice makes me feel handicapped. (voice_makes_me_feel_handicapped)
My voice "gives out" on me in the middle of speaking. (voice_gives_out)
I feel annoyed when people ask me to repeat. (annoyed_when_asked_to_repeat)
I feel embarrassed when people ask me to repeat. (feel_embarrassed_when_repeat_self)
My voice makes me feel incompetent. (voice_makes_me_feel_incompetent)
I'm ashamed of my voice problem. (ashamed_of_voice_problem)

SCORING: The score is the sum of the numerals in the multiplechoice responses. Physical Subscale: questions 2, 4, 10, 13, 14, 17, 18, 20, 21, 26 Emotional Subscale: questions 7, 9, 15, 23, 24, 25, 27, 28, 29, 30 Functional Subscale: questions 1, 3, 5, 6, 8, 11, 12, 16, 19, 22 SCALE: Functional: Mild greater than 10, Moderate greater than 12, Severe greater than 18 Physical: Mild greater than 15, Moderate greater than 18, Severe greater than 22 Emotional: Mild greater than 8, Moderate greater than 13, Severe greater than 20 Total: Mild greater than 33, Moderate greater than 44, Severe greater than 61 (scoring)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Voice Handicap Index (VHI) is a 30-item self-administered questionnaire that asks individuals to describe their voice and the effects of their voice on their life. Three subscales cover the areas of functional, emotional, and physical aspects of voice disorders. Points from the questions can be combined to assign a total score, or they can be combined by subscale.

form.longName: PhenX PX210201 - Childreported Parental Education Attain A0b6
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two questions from the National Longitudinal Study on Adolescent Health (Add Health) that ask the respondent to report on the highest level of education achieved by his/her residential parents (i.e., while growing up). The question may be administered via interview or through self-report questionnaire.

headerInstruction.text: This question is about the woman who functions as a mother in the respondent's household she could be the biological mother, stepmother, foster mother, or adoptive mother or, perhaps, a grandmother or aunt. If there is no such woman, the quest..TRUNCATED

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two questions from the National Longitudinal Study on Adolescent Health (Add Health) that ask the respondent to report on the highest level of education achieved by his/her residential parents (i.e., while growing up). The question may be administered via interview or through self-report questionnaire.

form.preferredDefinition: The Perceived Availability of Healthy Foods Scale from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA) is a three-item, interviewer-administered scale that measures the quality and availability of fresh fruit and vegetables and low-fat products in the local neighborhood. Higher mean scores indicate greater availability of healthy foods in the neighborhood (i.e., low-fat products, fruits, and vegetables).

question.questionText: The fresh fruits and vegetables in my neighborhood are of high quality. (quality_fresh_fruits_vegetables)
A large selection of fresh fruits and vegetables is available in my neighborhood. (large_selection_fresh_fruits_vegetables)
A large selection of lowfat products is available in my neighborhood. (large_selection_low_fat_products)

Scoring InstructionsThe Perceived Availability of Healthy Foods Scale is estimated by taking the average across the three items (note that only respondents with complete information for all three items can be assigned a scale score). Lower mean scores indicate better availability of healthy foods (i.e., lowfat products, fruits, and vegetables). Note that in papers by Moore, Diez Roux, and Brines (2008) and Moore et al. (2008) the fivepoint Likert scale was reported as follows: 0 = strongly agree 1 = agree 2 = neither agree nor disagree 3 = disagree and 4 = strongly disagree. (scoring_210701)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Perceived Availability of Healthy Foods Scale from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA) is a three-item, interviewer-administered scale that measures the quality and availability of fresh fruit and vegetables and low-fat products in the local neighborhood. Higher mean scores indicate greater availability of healthy foods in the neighborhood (i.e., low-fat products, fruits, and vegetables).

form.longName: PhenX PX201501 - Personal And Family History Of Hearing Loss
form.preferredDefinition: The Age-Related Hearing Impairment instrument is a self-administered questionnaire which asks about an individual's hearing impairment history, history of ear diseases and operations, family history, and history of exposure to loud noises.

module.longName: Personal and Family History of Hearing Loss
module.preferredDefinition: Personal and Family History of Hearing Loss

question.questionText: Do you have any difficulty with your hearing? (difficulty_hearing)
In which ear(s) do you have a hearing difficulty? (which_ear_affected)
At what age did you first notice a hearing difficulty? (age_first_noticed_hearing_difficulty)

validValue.meaningText: I have had a hearing difficulty since I was born
validValue.description: I have had a hearing difficulty since I was born

validValue.meaningText: My hearing difficulty developed during my childhood years (before the age of 15)
validValue.description: My hearing difficulty developed during my childhood years (before the age of 15)

validValue.description: My hearing difficulty developed between the ages of 15 and 40

validValue.meaningText: My hearing difficulty developed after the age of 40
validValue.description: My hearing difficulty developed after the age of 40

Do you know the reason for your hearing difficulty? (if there is a separate cause for each of your ears, please note them accordingly) (reason_for_difficulty)

validValue.meaningText: I have no idea about the cause of my hearing problem
validValue.description: I have no idea about the cause of my hearing problem

question.questionText: Do you know the reason for your hearing difficulty? (if there is a separate cause for each of your ears, please note them accordingly) Describe: (reason_for_difficulty_describe)
Does your hearing vary from day to day? (hearing_vary_day_to_day)
Do you find it very difficult to follow a conversation if there is background noise (e.g. TV, radio, children playing)? (background_noise)
Are you particularly sensitive to loud sounds? (sensitive_loud_sounds)
Do you sometimes feel a fullness or blockage in your ears? (fullness_in_ears)
Nowadays, do you ever get noises in your head or ears (tinnitus) which usually last longer than five minutes? (tinnitus)
Have you ever had an ear disease that has caused your hearing to get worse? (disease_caused_hearing_get_worse)
Have you ever had discharge of blood or pus, or smelly discharge (not wax) from either ear? (ear_discharge)
Have you ever had an ear operation? (ear_operation)

Which ear? (earoperation1_which_ear)
Which year? (approximately) (earoperation1_year)

validValue.meaningText: Yes, more than a year ago
validValue.description: Yes, more than a year ago

Other operation 1 type (other_operation1_type)
Other operation 1 year (other_operation1_year)
Other operation 2 (other_operation2_type)
Other operation 2 year (other_operation2_year)
Other operation 3 (other_operation3_type)
Other operation 3 year (other_operation3_year)
Other operation 4 (other_operation4_type)
Other operation 4 year (other_operation4_year)
Do you have other serious health problems that are not covered by the previous questions? (other_serious_health_problems)
Please describe these problems: (other_serious_health_problems_describe)
Have you ever been treated for a serious infection with an antibiotic (other than penicillin) which was administered by injection/drip for a week or more? (antibiotic_drip)
If 'YES', for what sort of infections did you receive these antibiotics? (antibiotic_drip_infection)
In which year(s) approximately? (antibiotic_drip_year)
Have you had cancer or leukaemia? (pxt201501_cancer)
Which kind of cancer or leukaemia? (cancer_type)
Have you been treated with chemotherapy or other medication for this condition? (cancer_chemotherapy_medication)
Have you been treated with chemotherapy or other medication for this condition? If 'YES', with: ______ (please fill in which medication if you know it) (cancer_chemotherapy_medication_type)
Have you been treated with chemotherapy or other medication for this condition? in __________ (in which year(s) approximately) (cancer_chemotherapy_medication_year)
Have you ever received radiotherapy to your head or neck for a tumour? (radiotherapy_tumor)
Have you ever received radiotherapy to your head or neck for a tumour? What kind of tumour(s)? (radiotherapy_tumor_type)
Have you ever received radiotherapy to your head or neck for a tumour? In which year(s) approximately? (radiotherapy_tumor_year)
On average how often do you take painkillers? (painkiller_frequency)

validValue.meaningText: less than 1 tablet a week (but more than one each month)
validValue.description: less than 1 tablet a week (but more than one each month)

question.questionText: Do you take aspirin on a daily basis for your heart or to dilute your blood? (daily_aspirin)
Do you take aspirin on a daily basis for your heart or to dilute your blood? If 'YES', how long have you been taking aspirin so far? (daily_aspirin_how_long)

module.longName: Please list all of the medication you have taken on a regular basis (for more than 3 months) in the last year or that you are taking now on a regular basis. Please write down the medical reason why you had or have to take this medication. If necessary you can add an additional copy of this page.
module.preferredDefinition: Please list all of the medication you have taken on a regular basis (for more than 3 months) in the last year or that you are taking now on a regular basis. Please write down the medical reason why you had or have to take this medication. If necessary you can add an additional copy of this page.

Have you ever fired a gun? (ever_fired_gun)
Light weapons (rifles/shotguns). Estimate the total number of shots fired. (light_weapons_number_shots)
Light weapons (rifles/shotguns). Did you use ear protection? (light_weapons_ear_protection)
Light weapons (rifles/shotguns). If any, which type of ear protection did you use? (light_weapons_ear_protection_type)
Heavy weapons (artillery/bazookas). Estimate the total number of shots fired. (heavy_weapons_number_shots)
Heavy weapons (artillery/bazookas). Did you use ear protection? (heavy_weapons_ear_protection)
Heavy weapons (artillery/bazookas). If any, which type of ear protection did you use? (heavy_weapons_ear_protection_type)

During your leisure time, are you/have you been regularly (more than once a week) exposed to loud sound or noise (so that you have to shout to make yourself heard by someone who was more than 1 m away from you)? (leisure_time_loud_noise)
What kind of loud sound? (leisure_time_loud_noise_type)
For how many years have you been exposed to this loud sound? (leisure_time_loud_noise_years)
How many hours per week have you been exposed to this loud sound? (leisure_time_loud_noise_hoursperweek)
Did you use ear protection? (leisure_time_loud_noise_earprotection)
If any, which type of ear protection did you use? (leisure_time_loud_noise_earprotectiontype)
What is/was your job? (occupation)
Have you been exposed to solvents (e.g., thrichloroethylene, toluene, evaporations from paints or lacquers) for more than one year in one of your jobs? (occupational_exposure_to_solvents)
Which solvents? (occupational_exposure_to_solvents_type)
In which year did the solvent exposure start? (occupational_exposure_to_solvents_start)
For how many years were you exposed to solvents? (occupational_exposure_to_solvents_years)
For how many hours per day were you exposed to solvents? (occupational_exposure_to_solvents_hoursperday)
Do you suffer from white finger syndrome/Raynaud's syndrome caused by excessive vibration (e.g., pneumatic hammers or drills)? (white_finger_syndrome)
Have you ever worked for more than 1 year in a place where you had to raise your voice to make yourself heard by someone standing 1 m away from you? (loud_working_environment)
Please describe the job (loud_working_environment_job)
Please give the name of the company (loud_working_environment_company)
Please describe the most important noise source(s) (loud_working_environment_noisesource)
In which year did you start to do this job? (loud_working_environment_start)
How many years have you been doing this job? (loud_working_environment_years)
What was the noise level (if you are aware of it) in dB? (loud_working_environment_noiselevel)
What was the noise dose (equivalent noise level if you are aware of it) in dBs? (loud_working_environment_noisedose)
How many hours per day were you exposed to noise? (loud_working_environment_hoursperday)
Was this a constant loud noise or an impulse noise (i.e., noise with (ir)regular high peaks of sound, like hammering)? (loud_working_environment_constant_impulse)
Did you use noise protection? (loud_working_environment_use_noiseprotection)
If any, which type of noise protection did you use? (loud_working_environment_noiseprotection_type)
What is your height? (height)
What is your height? Units (height_units)
What is your weight? (pxt201501_weight)
What is your weight? Units (weight_units)
Are you left or right handed? (handedness)
Are you susceptible to sunburn? (susceptible_to_sunburn)
What is the color of your eyes? (eye_color)

validValue.meaningText: very light blue or very light grey
validValue.description: very light blue or very light grey

question.questionText: Have you ever smoked regularly? (smoked_regularly)
At which age did you start smoking? (age_started_smoking)
For how many years did you (have you) smoke(d) up to now? (years_smoked)
Approximately how many cigarettes do (did) you smoke on average? (average_number_cigarettes_smoked)
Approximately how many cigars or cigarellos do (did) you smoke on average each day? (average_number_cigars)
Approximately how much pipe tobacco (grams) do (did) you smoke each day? (amount_pipe_tobacco)
Do you drink alcohol regularly (every week)? (drink_alcohol_regularly)
How many drinks do you have on average? (A small bottle of beer 25cl, red or white wine 12cl, or a small glass of spirits 4cl counts as 1 drink) (average_number_drinks)

Scoring Instructions: Please see Fransen et al., 2008 for a complete description of the statistical analysis used for these questions. Also, supplementary table 4 contains information on how the different variables were coded in this statistical analysis. (scoring_201501)

protocol.longName: Personal and Family History of Hearing Loss
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Age-Related Hearing Impairment instrument is a self-administered questionnaire which asks about an individual's hearing impairment history, history of ear diseases and operations, family history, and history of exposure to loud noises.
